Being a teenager and being very involved in my phone having a good phone is very important. Having the iPhone XR fulfills all those teenage needs. It does this by having outstanding battery life, it is inexpensive, and it has an amazing display. All these reasons support why I think it's the best phone on the market right now. My first reason to why this is such a good phone is that the XR has amazing battery life. Being a teenager I am on my phone a lot maybe sometimes a little too much but my major use of my cellphone is no match for the battery life of the XR. As long as I have my phone at 100 percent in the morning when I wake up you can be sure that it will last me the entire day. And even on the days that I forget to charge it during the night that's perfectly fine because it only takes 30 minutes for the phone to get 50 percent back. This is so important for many people not just teenagers but for people like business owners or other working adults because you don't always have to worry about charging your phone because you know that you have plenty of battery left. My next reason is that it is inexpensive. For a good cell phone prices can go from $600up to prices of $1000. For many 800, 900, and even 1000 dollars is a little too much to spend and the XR is a great compromise between those at its affordable price of $750. This is great for people who want an iPhone but don't want to pay the huge price tags that come with some of these phones. Lastly the XR has an amazing display. The screen like the X and the iPhone 11 has no home button and it extends up past the selfie camera. This is great because it utilizes the entire phone for the screen. column2: APPLE CONTROLS what you can do with YOUR OWN phone, pictures, music, media, etc.
column5: In Mother Russia, you don't control your phone, your PHONE controls YOU!  Oh wait it's your Iphone / Apple.  Yes, you purchased it but you don't really own it, Apple does!Thinking of "upgrading" from and Android to the fancy Iphone label & joining the hype?  I suggest you carefully reconsider.  The OS locks down your phone and what you are able to do with it is EXTREMELY LIMITED.  Where you used to have freedom and multiple options with how you stored, transferred, managed, and enjoyed your own music, picture, videos, media, etc., Apple locks that all down and takes the control away from you.  You only get 1 or 2 options which are all extremely limited in function, and Apple and users call that "Streamlined".Some examples:-Want to add music to your Iphone by simply dragging & dropping your files?Can't do that!  You have to download the clunky Itunes program on your computer to transfer songs.-Want to download the photos and videos you took with your Iphone?  It doesn't always work! You might have to go through Icloud, IF it lets you!  If Icloud is full and you try to download through USB using Apple's recommended method it might not read the device (it didn't for me).  And if you open your Iphone's internal storage on the computer and download the files manually, it will continually try to cut you off in the middle of downloading!-Have a favorite pair of headphones that you want to use?Too bad!  You have to buy one with Apple's Lightning connector, or buy an extra adapter that you now have to carry around.-Can't transfer certain songs?  Apple says it's for user protection and copyrights, even if you own the music CD.  What they really mean is you need to buy the songs AGAIN from Apple/Itunes.-Want to download YOUR OWN PICTURES with a quick drag and drop?NOPE, can't let you do that!  I was instructed to go through Itunes to do it but it wouldn't recognize ANY of my standard Jpegs.  So I was given a 2nd option of going through Icloud, where you can only upload a measly, pathetic 5gb of pics and videos-Have more than 5gb of pics and videos (like everyone else does)?No problem.  You just have to PAY a monthly subscription for more storage!-Want to set your songs to shuffle while connected to bluetooth?Too bad! No shuffle option unless your speakers/car gives you the option!  What the hell is this?!-Want play your songs with a better music app like you could easily do for free with Android!Nope, not happening!  When you were forced to sync your songs through Itunes it linked them only to the default Apple music app and the third party music player won't be able to find any of your music.-Want to quickly and easily organize your files into folder and subfolders like you could on your computer and Android?Can't let you do that for free!  Owners of Apple computers which cost 2x the price of similarly spec'd computer can, otherwise you can only have limited options through Apple's apps.-Want better sound quality in your car than Bluetooth?Apple can't let you have that!  I was able to connect any Android phone via USB to my fairly new 2yr old car for better sound quality and a full song menu but with the Iphone it's "invalid".Basically, all of the limitations that I've run into are PURPOSELY programmed by Apple.  These issues don't exist on Android! You paid for the phone but they control not only what you can do, and how you can use your Iphone, but they also control your pictures, music, media, etc. in relation to their devices.

The TLDR:  Ok phone that is not worth a $750 price tag.First, cosmetically, the phone is nice to look at. The build feels premium. Though, that is where the beauty stops. With such an ugly notch, thick housing and large bezels, the XR is aging prematurely when compared to other phones in the same price point. The LCD screen, though grand for an LCD, feels dated. Even the shear weight of this phone will feel much heavier than other phones with a similar screen size.The only major advantage of this phone is the battery life. I was able to get days of battery life after just a single charge. Unfortunately, the long battery life is somewhat trumped by the rediculously slow charge speed. If your XR has a low battery, be ready to plug it in overnight, because it will need a solid 8 hours to get back to a full charge. This felt like stepping back into the year 2013. This may be a good time to note that the charge cable and USB wall outlet adapter both feel cheap as though they were purchased from the dollar store.Video streaming lagged consistently when I tried to play YouTube or NetFlix. I'm not sure why, but I would commonly see a spinning circle on screen instead of the video I was trying to watch. This was quite annoying. The XR has the fastest chip set on the planet, yet it didn't perform as such.Apple still doesn't have Type-C on their 2018 models. This also makes the phone feel dated when so many other products have moved on to Type-C.
